definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
the blessing of three lifetimes (idiom)/(courteous language) it's my good fortune...

sentences.english: At the banquet table, I had the good fortune to sit vis-a-vis an old school chum.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸和一位昔日的老校友坐在宴會桌的對面。

sentences.english: I have heard of your wife for a long time. Today, I finally have the honor of meeting her.
sentences.chinese: 我可是久仰尊夫人的芳名，今天才有幸見到。

sentences.english: He is blessed in having such a good wife.
sentences.chinese: 他有幸娶到如此一位賢妻。

sentences.english: And we also had the privilege of meeting with some of their families, as well as some of the courageous survivors.
sentences.chinese: 我們還有幸會見了部分罹難者家屬和無畏的倖存者。

sentences.english: Bradley was able to witness his parents' marriage at Christmastime that year.
sentences.chinese: 那年聖誕節期間，布拉德利有幸見證了他父母的婚禮。

sentences.english: Even the mayor came by and had the honor of naming the infant after himself.
sentences.chinese: 甚至市長也來了，並有幸以自己的名字爲這嬰兒命名。

sentences.english: Recently I was fortunate enough to visit China and live within Jinan for nearly a month.
sentences.chinese: 最近，我有幸訪問和生活在中國的濟南，約有一個月。

sentences.english: Since 2000, I've been fortunate to cover five All-Star Weekends.
sentences.chinese: 算上2000年那次，本人有幸報道過五次全明星。

sentences.english: She was fortunate enough to receive a scholarship from a world-class university.
sentences.chinese: 她有幸獲得了世界名牌大學的獎學金。

sentences.english: Luckily I find a soul mate.
I could even see some of the landscape paintings.
sentences.chinese: 我當時甚至還有幸觀賞其中的一些風景畫。

sentences.english: Part 7. It was a great privilege to hear her sing .
sentences.chinese: 聽她唱歌真是三生有幸。

sentences.english: For two weeks, I had the opportunity to room with one of the biggest players I have ever known.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸與我知道的最厲害的“玩家”同室了兩個星期。

sentences.english: It is a privilege to be talking to you nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 當今能跟你談話真是我三生有幸。

sentences.english: It is a privilege to be speaking to you today.
sentences.chinese: 今天能跟你談話真是咱三生有幸。

sentences.english: It was my good fortune to teach in the Overseas Training Department of Shang- hai International Studies University (SISU).
sentences.chinese: 我有幸在上海外國語大學海外培訓部任教。

definition: to see for oneself/to see with one's own eyes
your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
to witness/to see at first hand/to see with one's own eyes
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to get to know sb/to meet sb for the first time
